search_information.query_displayed: Acquiring Credentials When Signals Don't Matter: Employers' Support of Employees Who Pursue Postsecondary Vocational Degrees. Bills, David B. Wacker, Mary Ellen Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Acquiring credentials when signals don't matter: Employers' support of employees who pursue postsecondary vocational degrees
organic_results.snippet: Previous research has established that employers respond to postsecondary vocational degrees when hiring employees. Because employers lack information on the productive capacity of new employees, these credentials may signal preexisting capacities, rather than the acquisition of new skills. Employers' support for participation in vocational education programs by current employees, whose productive capacity is directly observable, suggests that the programs enhance participants' skills in ways that employers reward. This study …
